perturbation.original_text: (f) To make generally available to securityholders of the Company as soon as practicable, but in any event not later than eighteen months after the effective date of the Registration Statement (as defined in Rule 158(c) under the Act), an earnings statement of the Company and its subsidiaries (which need not be audited) complying with Section 11(a) of the Act and the rules and regulations thereunder (including, at the option of the Company, Rule 158);
perturbation.changed_text: (f) To make generally available to securityholders of the Company as soon as practicable, but in any event not later than thirty-six months after the effective date of the Registration Statement (as defined in Rule 158(c) under the Act), an earnings statement of the Company and its subsidiaries (which need not be audited) complying with Section 11(a) of the Act and the rules and regulations thereunder (including, at the option of the Company, Rule 158);
perturbation.explanation: This change extends the deadline for providing an earnings statement to securityholders from eighteen months to thirty-six months. This introduces non-compliance because the SEC requires that an earnings statement be made available no later than eighteen months after the effective date of the registration statement to comply with Section 11(a) of the Securities Act of 1933.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Section 11(a) of the Securities Act of 1933

perturbation.original_text: 7. Resignation and Removal of the Remarketing Agents. A Remarketing Agent may resign and be discharged from its duties and obligations hereunder, and the Company may remove any or all of the Remarketing Agents, by giving five (5) Business Days' prior written notice to the Stock Purchase Contract Agent and, in the case of a removal, to the Remarketing Agents; provided that no such resignation nor any removal of all the Remarketing Agents shall become effective until the Company shall have appointed at least one nationally recognized broker-dealer as successor to the Remarketing Agents, and such successor Remarketing Agent shall have entered into a   28
perturbation.changed_text: 7. Resignation and Removal of the Remarketing Agents. A Remarketing Agent may resign and be discharged from its duties and obligations hereunder, and the Company may remove any or all of the Remarketing Agents, by giving one (1) Business Days' prior written notice to the Stock Purchase Contract Agent and, in the case of a removal, to the Remarketing Agents; provided that no such resignation nor any removal of all the Remarketing Agents shall become effective until the Company shall have appointed at least one nationally recognized broker-dealer as successor to the Remarketing Agents, and such successor Remarketing Agent shall have entered into a   28
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the prior written notice from five business days to one business day may be insufficient time to ensure a smooth transition and maintain regulatory compliance. FINRA (Financial Industry Regulatory Authority) rules often require longer periods for certain notifications and transitions, particularly those involving significant roles like remarketing agents. This abrupt change introduces risk of non-compliance with FINRA regulations regarding operational changes and notifications.
perturbation.contradicted_law: FINRA Rules (potentially impacting operational and notification requirements)

perturbation.original_text: 13. Notices. All statements, requests, notices and agreements hereunder shall be in writing and shall be deemed to have been duly given if mailed or transmitted by any standard form of telecommunication; notices to the Remarketing Agents shall be directed to Deutsche Bank Securities Inc., 60 Wall Street, New York, NY 10005, with a copy to Debevoise & Plimpton LLP, 919 Third Avenue, New York, New York 10022, attention of Peter J. Loughran, Esq.; notices to the Company shall be delivered or sent by mail, telex or facsimile transmission to the address of the Company set forth in the Registration Statement, Attention: General Counsel, with a copy to Willkie Farr & Gallagher LLP, 787 Seventh Avenue, New York, NY 10019, attention John M. Schwolsky, Esq. and Vladimir Nicenko, Esq.; notices to the Trustee shall be delivered or sent by mail or facsimile transmission to The Bank of New York Mellon Trust Company, N.A., 2 North LaSalle Street, Suite 1020, Chicago, Illinois 60602, telecopy: (312) 827-8542; notices to the Stock Purchase Contract Agent shall be delivered or sent by mail or facsimile transmission to Deutsche Bank Trust Company Americas, Trust and Securities Services, 60 Wall Street, 16th Floor, MS: NYC60-2710, New York, NY 10005, telecopy: (732) 578-4635; and notices to the Collateral Agent or the Custodial Agent shall be delivered or sent by mail or facsimile transmission to Deutsche Bank Trust Company Americas, Trust and Securities Services, 60 Wall Street, 16th Floor, MS: NYC60-2710, New York, NY 10005, telecopy: (732) 578-4635. Any such statements, requests, notices or agreements shall take effect at the time of receipt thereof.
perturbation.changed_text: 13. Notices. All statements, requests, notices and agreements hereunder shall be in writing and shall be deemed to have been duly given if sent via carrier pigeon; notices to the Remarketing Agents shall be directed to Deutsche Bank Securities Inc., 60 Wall Street, New York, NY 10005, with a copy to Debevoise & Plimpton LLP, 919 Third Avenue, New York, New York 10022, attention of Peter J. Loughran, Esq.; notices to the Company shall be delivered or sent by carrier pigeon to the address of the Company set forth in the Registration Statement, Attention: General Counsel, with a copy to Willkie Farr & Gallagher LLP, 787 Seventh Avenue, New York, NY 10019, attention John M. Schwolsky, Esq. and Vladimir Nicenko, Esq.; notices to the Trustee shall be delivered or sent by carrier pigeon to The Bank of New York Mellon Trust Company, N.A., 2 North LaSalle Street, Suite 1020, Chicago, Illinois 60602, telecopy: (312) 827-8542; notices to the Stock Purchase Contract Agent shall be delivered or sent by carrier pigeon to Deutsche Bank Trust Company Americas, Trust and Securities Services, 60 Wall Street, 16th Floor, MS: NYC60-2710, New York, NY 10005, telecopy: (732) 578-4635; and notices to the Collateral Agent or the Custodial Agent shall be delivered or sent by carrier pigeon to Deutsche Bank Trust Company Americas, Trust and Securities Services, 60 Wall Street, 16th Floor, MS: NYC60-2710, New York, NY 10005, telecopy: (732) 578-4635. Any such statements, requests, notices or agreements shall take effect only upon successful arrival of the carrier pigeon at the designated location.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the method of notice delivery to 'carrier pigeon' is not a 'standard form of telecommunication' or an established method of delivery, violating standards of commercially reasonable communication. This introduces uncertainty and potential delays in delivering notices, which contradicts legal expectations for reliable communication in contractual obligations. This also introduces uncertainty about the time of receipt.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles requiring reasonable and reliable communication.
